bill_title: revise the provisions concerning the types of taxes that the state may enter into compacts with Indian tribes.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the provisions concerning the types of taxes that the state may enter into compacts with Indian tribes. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-12A-4 be amended to read as follows: 10-12A-4. The department may enter into tax collection agreements with any Indian tribe under the provisions of this chapter and chapter 1-24. These agreements may provide for the collection of any of the following state taxes and any tribal taxes imposed by a tribe that are identical to the following state taxes: (1) The retail sales and service tax imposed by chapter 10-45; (2) The use tax imposed by chapter 10-46; (3) The contractors' excise tax imposed by chapter 10-46A; (4) The alternate contractors' excise tax imposed by chapter 10-46B; (5) The cigarette tax imposed by chapter 10-50; (6) The motor vehicle excise tax imposed by chapter 32-5B; or (7) The fuel excise tax imposed by chapter 10-47B ; (8) The telecommunications services gross receipts tax imposed by § 10-33-21 and chapter 10-33A; (9) The rural electric gross receipts tax imposed by chapter 10-36; (10) The mineral severance tax imposed by chapter 10-39; (11) The energy minerals severance tax imposed by chapter 10-39A; (12) The income tax on banks and financial corporations imposed by chapter 10-43; (13) The insurance company premium and annuity tax imposed by chapter 10-44; (14) The gross receipts tax on visitor related businesses imposed by chapter 10-45D; or (15) The amusement device tax imposed by chapter 10-58 . The agreement may provide for the retention by the department of an agreed-upon percentage of the gross revenue as an administrative fee.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
